dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S910 PCS: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify the special rules for accident and health plans of certain governmental entities, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hatch, from the Committee on Finance, reported the following original bill; which was read twice and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify the special rules for accident and health plans of certain governmental entities, and for other purposes.

section.header: Clarification of special rule for certain governmental plans

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 105(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the taxpayer and inserting a qualified taxpayer, and
by striking deceased plan participant's beneficiary and inserting deceased employee's beneficiary (other than an individual described in paragraph (3)(B)).

subsection.text: Subsection (j) of section 105 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: For purposes of paragraph (1), with respect to an accident or health plan described in paragraph (2), the term qualified taxpayer means a taxpayer who is—

subparagraph.text: the spouse, dependent (as defined for purposes of subsection (b)), or child (as defined for purposes of such subsection) of an employee.

subsection.header: Application to political subdivisions of States
subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 105(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting or established by or on behalf of a State or political subdivision thereof after public retirement system, and
by inserting or 501(c)(9) after section 115 in subparagraph (B).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to payments after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increase in continuous levy for Medicare providers and suppliers

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 6331(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 30 percent and inserting 35 percent.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to payments made after 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

endorsement.action-desc: Read twice and placed on the calendar
